intro: Mitranthes pilosa, commonly known as the hairy mitranthes, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
